html:
The world has changed a lot since the “Digital Peak” of 2020–2021 and such changes are likely to bring new opportunities

The past few years have brought significant shifts in the job market for design professionals. Many of these changes have been difficult—marked by layoffs, career pivots, and a tougher job landscape compared to the relatively dynamic and opportunity-rich years of 2020–2021. I like to call that period the “Digital Peak,” when businesses raced to transform digitally in response to the COVID-19 pandemic.

However, as history consistently shows us, big shifts often create new opportunities for those who can identify and align themselves with the forces shaping the future. In this article, I’ll explore how emerging trends across economics, technology, and geopolitics are opening doors for design professionals, including those in UX design, service design, and UX research, and for those driving the product development cycle, like product owners and managers.
